widget.name: CSS Grid
widget.description: A powerful CSS Grid implementation for creating complex, responsive layouts

property.caption: Use Named Areas
property.description: Enable to use grid-area instead of grid-column/row for item placement. When enabled, you can define named regions in your grid and place items by area name.

property.caption: Grid Template Columns
property.description:
Define the columns of your grid. Examples: - 1fr 2fr 1fr - Three columns with middle twice as wide - repeat(3, 1fr) - Three equal columns - 200px 1fr 200px - Fixed sidebars with flexible center - repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr)) - Responsive columns
This property is always used, even when using named areas, to define column sizes.

property.caption: Grid Template Rows
property.description:
Define the rows of your grid. Examples: - auto - Rows size to content - 100px auto 50px - Fixed header/footer with flexible content - repeat(3, 200px) - Three rows of 200px each - minmax(100px, auto) - Minimum 100px, grows with content
This property can be used with named areas to define row heights.

property.caption: Grid Template Areas
property.description:
Define named grid areas when "Use Named Areas" is enabled.
FORMAT: Use standard CSS grid-template-areas syntax with quotes.
Example: "header header header" "sidebar main aside" "footer footer footer"
Use dots (.) for empty cells: "header header ." "sidebar main aside" ". footer footer"
Rules: - Each row must be wrapped in quotes - Each row must have the same number of columns - Area names must start with a letter - Use only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores - Areas must form rectangles (can't be L-shaped)

property.caption: Gap
property.description: Sets both row and column gaps at once. Examples: - 16px - 16 pixels between all cells - 1rem - 1rem spacing - 2% - Percentage of container When set, this overrides individual row/column gap settings.

property.caption: Row Gap
property.description: Sets the gap between rows only. Use any CSS length unit (px, rem, %, etc.). This is ignored if the general "Gap" property is set.

property.caption: Column Gap
property.description: Sets the gap between columns only. Use any CSS length unit (px, rem, %, etc.). This is ignored if the general "Gap" property is set.

property.caption: Min Width
property.description: Minimum width of the grid container (e.g., 300px, 20rem, 50%)

property.caption: Max Width
property.description: Maximum width of the grid container. When set, the grid will be centered. Examples: 1200px, 80rem, 90%

property.caption: Min Height
property.description: Minimum height of the grid container (e.g., 400px, 100vh)

property.caption: Max Height
property.description: Maximum height of the grid container (e.g., 800px, 80vh)

property.caption: Justify Items
property.description: How to align items horizontally within their cells: - Start: Align to left edge - End: Align to right edge - Center: Center horizontally - Stretch: Fill the cell width (default)

property.caption: Align Items
property.description: How to align items vertically within their cells: - Start: Align to top edge - End: Align to bottom edge - Center: Center vertically - Stretch: Fill the cell height (default)

property.caption: Justify Content
property.description: How to align the entire grid horizontally when it's smaller than its container: - Start: Align to left - End: Align to right - Center: Center the grid - Stretch: Stretch to fill width - Space Between: Even space between columns - Space Around: Even space around columns - Space Evenly: Even space including edges

property.caption: Align Content
property.description: How to align the entire grid vertically when it's smaller than its container: - Start: Align to top - End: Align to bottom - Center: Center the grid - Stretch: Stretch to fill height (default) - Space Between: Even space between rows - Space Around: Even space around rows - Space Evenly: Even space including edges

property.caption: Auto Flow
property.description:
How auto-placed items flow into the grid: - Row: Fill each row before moving to next - Column: Fill each column before moving to next - Row Dense: Row-wise, filling gaps - Column Dense: Column-wise, filling gaps
Dense packing can reorder items to minimize gaps.

property.caption: Auto Rows
property.description: Size of rows created automatically when items overflow the defined grid. Examples: auto, 200px, minmax(100px, auto), 1fr

property.caption: Auto Columns
property.description: Size of columns created automatically when items overflow the defined grid. Examples: auto, 200px, minmax(100px, auto), 1fr

property.caption: Enable Breakpoints
property.description: Enable different grid configurations at various screen sizes.

property.caption: Responsive Mode
property.description: How breakpoints apply: - Exact: Each breakpoint only applies within its specific range - Cascade: Breakpoints inherit from smaller sizes (mobile-first)

property.caption: Grid Items
property.description: Items to place in the grid. Each item can have its own placement rules and responsive settings.

property.caption: Item Name
property.description: A descriptive name for this grid item (shown in preview, helpful for debugging)

property.caption: Content
property.description: Widget(s) to place in this grid cell

property.caption: CSS Class
property.description: Additional CSS classes for this grid item

property.caption: Dynamic Classes
property.description: Expression that returns CSS class names based on data (e.g., based on attribute values)

property.caption: Render As
property.description: HTML element to render this grid item as. Use semantic elements for better accessibility and SEO. Note: Only one 'main' element should exist per page.

property.caption: Placement Type
property.description: How to place this item in the grid: - Auto: Let the grid auto-flow algorithm place it - Named Area: Place in a specific named area (requires "Use Named Areas") - Coordinates: Specify exact start/end lines - Span: Start at a position and span multiple cells

property.caption: Grid Area
property.description: Name of the area to place this item in (only used when placement type is "Named Area" and container has "Use Named Areas" enabled)

property.caption: Column Start
property.description:
Starting column line. Formats: - auto - Automatic placement - 1, 2, 3 - Line number (1 is the first line) - -1, -2 - Count from end (-1 is the last line) - span 2 - Span 2 columns (only for Span placement)
Used for Coordinates and Span placement types.

property.caption: Column End
property.description: Ending column line (only for Coordinates placement). Same format as Column Start, but defines where the item ends.

property.caption: Row Start
property.description:
Starting row line. Formats: - auto - Automatic placement - 1, 2, 3 - Line number - -1, -2 - Count from end - span 2 - Span 2 rows (only for Span placement)
Used for Coordinates and Span placement types.

property.caption: Row End
property.description: Ending row line (only for Coordinates placement). Same format as Row Start, but defines where the item ends.

property.caption: Justify Self
property.description: Override horizontal alignment for this specific item

property.caption: Align Self
property.description: Override vertical alignment for this specific item

property.caption: Z-Index
property.description: Stack order when items overlap. Higher values appear on top. Values: numbers (-999 to 999) or keywords (auto, initial, inherit, unset)

property.caption: Responsive Placement
property.description: Enable responsive placement per screen size. When enabled, you can override placement and alignment for each breakpoint.

property.caption: Efficient Loading
property.description: Enable smart rendering for grids with many items. Only items currently visible on screen are fully rendered, dramatically improving performance for large grids.

property.caption: Loading Threshold
property.description: Number of items before efficient loading activates (default: 100). For example, if set to 50, grids with 50+ items will use efficient loading.

property.caption: Show Grid Lines

property.caption: Show Grid Areas

property.caption: Show Grid Gaps

property.caption: Show Grid Info
